title: Fallout Is The Franchise That Bethesda Is "Doing The Most In" Right Now
description: Fallout fans have been understandably curious about the future of the franchise, especially since Fallout 5 isn't expected to arrive before The Elder Scrolls 6, and Bethesda hasn't been very forthcoming about when that game is coming either. For now, Bethesda's Todd Howard is keeping the company's plans close to his vest, but he has indicated there's more happening with Fallout than any other Bethesda property at the moment. "We've had a long-term plan for Fallout, and so I wish I could talk about all those today," Howard told IGN. "I'll just say this, it's the franchise that we're doing the most in right now." Howard also indicated that the success of Prime Video's Fallout TV series hasn't altered those plans or caused Bethesda to move up its timetable. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: How to Buy A Mansion In GTA Online And All Customization Options
description: The Safehouse in the Hills update in GTA Online has also been called the "Mansion Update," and it's easy to see why. The update has introduced full-fledged mansions into Los Santos, allowing you to live life like Michael and Franklin from the story mode of GTA V. You can even access a new Michael mission in the Safehouse in the Hills update, if you've been missing the aging fella. Between completing missions in Safehouse in the Hills, though, you might be curious about acquiring and customizing your mansion in GTA Online. Below, you can see a full rundown of how the mansions work in Los Santos. How to buy a Mansion in GTA Online To purchase one of the new mansions in GTA Online, you'll have to visit a specific website on your phone, and you'll need quite a large sum of money. Mansions can be purchased by visiting the Prix Luxury Real Estate website, and there are three mansions to choose from. You can see what they are and how much they cost below: Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Battlefield 6's Buggy Update Is Being Fixed, As New Patches Scheduled And Tournament Delayed
description: The Winter Offensive update went live in Battlefield 6 on December 9, bringing new content and a limited-time event. Unfortunately, the update also added a host of issues that affected gameplay. The problems were so severe that the developer has now postponed Battlefield 6's $1 million tournament series for Redsec and outlined the fixes planned for future updates. The Winter Offensive update caused a wide variety of issues across all platforms, with bugs related to the Breakthrough and Portal modes, as well as performance issues with stuttering on PC. There was even a main menu issue that prevented some players from selecting and playing game modes. The developer has responded with a new community update post, which details known issues as well as new updates planned to release before the holidays. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Deus Ex Remastered Delayed To "Better Meet Fan Expectations"
description: Developer Aspyr Media announced that Deus Ex Remastered has been delayed (seemingly indefinitely) so the team can "deliver the best possible experience." Aspyr delivered the news on X, posting that, alongside a commitment to delivering the best possible experience, the team wants to meet the expectations of its fanbase. Thank you to the community for your feedback following the reveal of Deus Ex Remastered. We've listened to what you said, and in order to better meet fan expectations and deliver the best possible experience for players, Deus Ex Remastered will no longer launch on Feb. 5, 2026. pic.twitter.com/NhalyPLm8q ‚Äî Aspyr (@AspyrMedia) December 11, 2025 As such, the game has been pushed back from its initial February 5, 2026 release date. More updates will be shared "when the time comes," Aspyr said. By delaying the game, the studio is also refunding all preorders while thanking fans for their continued patience and support. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Analyst Report: Autozone Inc.
Ugly Sonic Returns As Fan Edit Will Restore The Infamous Original Design
description: Five years after the first live-action Sonic the Hedgehog movie was released, fans have almost forgotten how close they came to seeing pure nightmare fuel in that blockbuster movie. The original Sonic design was a strange mix of blue fur and too many teeth, but the redesign of Sonic that followed was far more faithful to the video games. A26, a group of renegade Sonic fans, isn't satisfied with it. They're busy putting Ugly Sonic back into the movie, with a project called Sonic the Hedgehog: The 2019 Cut, and a trailer for it is set to be released on December 24. A26 originally intended to have the trailer out this week, but they weren't satisfied with the result and pushed the date back a few weeks. "We wanted Sonic‚Äôs animation to feel as fluid as possible, and to be honest, it would have gotten some negative reviews if we‚Äôd released it today," A26 wrote in a social media post. "We promise it will be totally worth it, paying tribute to the original design as it always should have been." A short clip for you all ü´£Hope you like It#GottaFixFastüåÄü¶î pic.twitter.com/2ET7vPsZSV ‚Äî Sonic The Hedgehog: The 2019 Cut (@SonicCut2026) December 11, 2025 To give you an idea of what you can expect, A26 releases a short GIF of Ugly Sonic jogging inside a washing machine. The project is expected to be released online in 2026. While it's going to be a long wait to see the 2019 cut of Sonic the Hedgehog, you can see the infamous character--voiced by I Think You Should Leave's Tim Robinson--save the day in 2022's Chip 'n Dale movie. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: GTA 6 Clues May Be Hidden In GTA Online's Big New Update, Fans Think
description: The recent A Safehouse in the Hills update for GTA Online may contain clues about Grand Theft Auto VI, or at least that's what the franchise's passionate fanbase is theorizing based on some recent discoveries. After the big new update went live on December 10, people dug into the game's code in search of anything that might provide clues about GTA 6, and people think they found some. A line of text that was discovered references a voice line for the character Jimmy, the son of main character Michael, that says he is "moving out of state." Another line, from his mother Amanda, says, "Our son is finally moving away from home." People are taking this to suggest that Jimmy may have moved to Leonida, the stand-in for GTA 6's setting of Florida, but that's just conjecture for now. Dataminers also discovered that the KnoWay autonomous driving company that was added to GTA Online in the new update was formerly known as Sahara. That is the name of a delivery and logistics company for GTA 6, as seen in previously released GTA 6 screenshots. The dataminer, Tex2, theorized that Rockstar might have at one point planned a Part 2 for the A Safehouse in the Hills expansion to be timed with GTA 6's previous release date of May 2026 prior to the game's delay to November 2026. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Finally, Bigfoot Has Been Spotted For Real ... In Fortnite
description: Bigfoot isn't a myth. It's real, and it's really wandering around the forests ... in Fortnite, as a new update added the mythical sasquatch to the battle royale shooter. Thanks to a recent 39.10 update that landed on December 11, players noticed something strange in Fortnite's woods. Apparently, Epic Games introduced Bigfoot to the game's sprawling world, but it isn't easy to find. Bigfoot roams the entire map, meaning it could appear by the Fore Fields, near the Humble Hills, and anywhere in between. It's also immune to damage, so shooting it means nothing. And if you get within 35 meters, it vanishes, leaving you on yet another wild sasquatch hunt before getting blasted to death. BIGFOOT WAS ADDED IN TODAY'S UPDATE üò≠He walks around the entire map, is immune to damage, and will disappear if you get too close to him(via @FN_Assist) pic.twitter.com/Mdi5GxeSoU ‚Äî Shiina (@ShiinaBR) December 11, 2025 Contrary to its name, however, Bigfoot isn't that big. As players found it, it actually appears rather little. The perspective could be off, but based on screenshots circulating on X, Bigfoot looks no bigger than a budding flower. Maybe it should be known as "Littlefoot," then. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Here's How Much It Could Cost To Show A Game At The Game Awards
description: A new report detailed how much it costs for developers to have their games shown off at The Game Awards. Kotaku reported that a 60-second trailer can cost up to $450,000, with the price scaling to $1 million for a three-minute trailer. The ad sales team for The Game Awards can charge that much due in part to the show's massive scale. The Game Awards 2024 drew an audience of 154 million livestreams, which was up from 118 million for The Game Awards 2023. This counts streams on YouTube, Twitch, Steam, TikTok, X, Instagram, Facebook, and international platforms like Bilibili and WeChat in China, among other sources. The viewership number for The Game Awards 2024 was many millions higher than the latest Super Bowl (127.7 million), but the comparison is not apples to apples. Super Bowl ads for Super Bowl LIX this past February reportedly cost as much as $8 million for 30 seconds. Continue Reading at GameSpot
